tweet: The on-chain data is overwhelming.  The new, weak handed investors are selling to the experienced, strong handed investors.  People who have been around for awhile love cheap bitcoin.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: This morning a bunch of folks were screaming bitcoin was going lower.  Now those people are screaming that bitcoin is going higher.  Nobody knows what is going to happen to price in the short term.  Stop trying to day trade a highly volatile asset.  Think long term & chill.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: REMINDER: Majority of the bitcoin bulls are heavily invested in the asset, while nearly none of the bears are shorting it.  Stop listening to what people say and simply see who has true skin in the game.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: Imagine back in November when bitcoin was around $10,000 if someone had told you:  "Bitcoin has crashed to $30,000 and everyone is scared!!"

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies are the last remaining free market.  There are no circuit breakers. There are no hours of operations. There are no bailouts. Each person is left to participate in the market how they see fit.  Every market should be the same.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: Today at 12noon EST I'm talking with Genesis Trading CEO @michaelmoro about corporations putting bitcoin on their balance sheet.  - Why they're doing it - Pros/cons - Public vs private companies - How to execute it safely - Accounting treatment  RSVP here:  https://t.co/PsGW8qj5e1

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 11/11 So here is what I'm thinking and doing right now:  - Strong belief in bitcoin - Long term view on asset - Dollar cost averaging aggressively - Not worried over short term price - Plan to hand bitcoin to my grandchildren  Could I be wrong? Sure. I'm not betting on it though.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 10/ Given my long time horizon view, the longer bitcoin stays at depressed prices, the more bitcoin I can accumulate at these levels.  This is a weird thing with most bitcoin holders. The strong hands welcome low prices for long periods of time because it helps with accumulation.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 9/ I have no clue where the price of bitcoin is going in the short term. It could go higher. It could go lower.  I simply don't know and don't believe most people know either.  However, I know that I want to own as much bitcoin as possible for the long term.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 7/ The key to investing in a volatile asset like bitcoin is that you have to size your portfolio allocation correctly.  Don't invest money that you will need for daily expenses or money that you can't afford to lose.   Markets are volatile. Long term investing means LONG TERM.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 6/ I don't care about the short term price movement of bitcoin after I buy it. Remember, I'm not a trader.  I buy the asset and tell myself that I'm going to hand it to my grandchildren one day.  As Warren Buffett famously says, "our favorite holding period is forever."

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 5/ When the price of bitcoin falls, which it has been doing for the last few weeks, I try to speed up the frequency of my dollar cost averaging.   Given my oversized exposure to the asset, this isn't always easy. But I do my best and spend most of my time trying to find more $$

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 4/ The dollar cost average strategy relies on the idea that "time in the market is more important than timing the market."  This has historically been true in bitcoin. The asset has an annual compound growth rate of over 100% throughout the last decade.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 3/ The idea has always been to dollar cost average into bitcoin.  For those that don't know what this is, I basically buy bitcoin on a periodic basis without caring what the price is.   Sometimes I buy when price is high. Sometimes I buy when the price is low. Weekly or monthly.

name: Pomp ğŸŒª
tweet: 2/ My strategy with bitcoin over the last few years is simple â€” accumulate as much bitcoin as I can.  The word accumulate is important. That is an action you do with no intention of selling for profit later.
